title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE (AP) – On a night when the rim must have looked as wide as the ocean, Glen Rice delivered a performance for the ages, single-handedly shooting the Charlotte Hornets to a stunning 102-95 victory over the Milwaukee Bucks.

Rice was nothing short of magnificent, pouring in a game-high 42 points in a breathtaking display of offensive firepower. He was a model of efficiency, connecting on 14 of his 23 attempts from the field. But it was from beyond the arc where he authored his masterpiece, draining an incredible 8 three-pointers to leave the Bucks defense scrambling and the Charlotte Coliseum in a state of delirium. Every time Milwaukee threatened to close the gap, Rice had the answer, a cold-blooded jumper silencing the rally.

While Rice’s scoring explosion was the headline, his teammates provided the necessary support. Vlade Divac anchored the paint with a solid 13 points and 8 rebounds, while Anthony Mason facilitated the offense with 7 assists to go with his 6 points.

The Bucks, despite the loss, had a strong performance from Vin Baker, who fought hard for 25 points and 11 rebounds. Sherman Douglas added 19 points, but Milwaukee simply had no counter for the hurricane named Glen Rice.

In the end, this was not merely a game won on the scoreboard; it was a coronation. For one night in Charlotte, Glen Rice was unstoppable, putting on a shooting clinic that will be remembered long after the final buzzer sounded. His 42-point outburst, fueled by a torrent of threes, was the definitive story of a memorable Hornets triumph.
